sections.title: Teeth whitening
sections.body:
Teeth whitening is a cosmetic treatment used to lighten the natural colour of teeth.

It can help reduce staining and discolouration that develops over time, but it isn’t suitable for everyone and results vary between individuals.

Whitening is always assessed and supervised by a dentist to ensure it’s appropriate and safe for your teeth and gums.

If whitening is suitable, treatment is carried out under dental supervision here at our Shoreham-by-Sea practice.

At St Mary’s House Dental Care, whitening is approached carefully, with clear discussion about expectations and suitability.
bullets: Teeth whitening is a cosmetic treatment used to lighten the natural colour of teeth.
Whitening is always assessed and supervised by a dentist to ensure it’s appropriate and safe for your teeth and gums.
Whitening is approached carefully, with clear discussion about expectations and suitability.

ctas.label: Plan a clinician-led teeth whitening review

sections.title: Why teeth become discoloured
items: Tooth colour can change for many reasons.
Common factors include natural ageing, diet, smoking, previous dental treatment, or changes within the tooth itself.
Understanding the cause of discolouration helps determine whether whitening is likely to be effective.

sections.eyebrow: Who teeth whitening may be suitable for
sections.title: Who teeth whitening may be suitable for
sections.body:
Teeth whitening may be appropriate for people with generally healthy teeth and gums who want to lighten their natural tooth shade.

An assessment is always needed first, as existing restorations such as fillings, crowns, or veneers do not change colour with whitening.

We’ll explain whether whitening is suitable and what outcome is realistic.
bullets: Teeth whitening may be appropriate for people with generally healthy teeth and gums who want to lighten their natural tooth shade.
An assessment is always needed first.
Existing restorations such as fillings, crowns, or veneers do not change colour with whitening.
We’ll explain whether whitening is suitable and what outcome is realistic.

sections.title: Comfort and sensitivity
sections.body:
Some people experience temporary sensitivity during or after whitening.

This is usually short-lived and settles once treatment stops.

We’ll advise on how to manage sensitivity and whether adjustments are needed.

sections.title: Types of teeth whitening
sections.body:
There are different approaches to whitening, including professionally supervised home whitening and in-practice treatments.

The method recommended depends on your teeth, sensitivity levels, and the type of discolouration present.

We’ll discuss options and explain how they work.
bullets: The method recommended depends on your teeth, sensitivity levels, and the type of discolouration present.
We’ll discuss options and explain how they work.

faqs.question: Who is whitening suitable for?
faqs.answer: Teeth whitening may be appropriate for people with generally healthy teeth and gums who want to lighten their natural tooth shade. An assessment is always needed first.

faqs.question: What about sensitivity?
faqs.answer: Some people experience temporary sensitivity during or after whitening. This is usually short-lived and settles once treatment stops.

faqs.question: What results should I expect?
faqs.answer: Whitening can lighten the colour of natural teeth, but it does not create a uniform or artificial white appearance. Results vary depending on tooth structure, starting shade, and lifestyle factors.

faqs.question: How can I maintain results?
faqs.answer: The longevity of whitening results depends on individual habits and oral care. Diet, smoking, and oral hygiene all play a role.

sections.title: Results and limitations
sections.body:
Whitening can lighten the colour of natural teeth, but it does not create a uniform or artificial white appearance.

Results vary depending on tooth structure, starting shade, and lifestyle factors.

We’ll help you understand what whitening can and cannot achieve.
bullets: Whitening can lighten the colour of natural teeth.
It does not create a uniform or artificial white appearance.
Results vary depending on tooth structure, starting shade, and lifestyle factors.
We’ll help you understand what whitening can and cannot achieve.

sections.title: Start with a whitening consultation
sections.strapline: Contact us to discuss whether dentist-led whitening is suitable for you.

sections.title: Maintaining results
items: The longevity of whitening results depends on individual habits and oral care.
Diet, smoking, and oral hygiene all play a role.
We’ll discuss how to maintain results realistically over time.
